title: Women’s Super League Grand Final: Castleford Tigers bid to avenge successive Challenge Cup final defeats to Leeds Rhinos
text:
Castleford Tigers women’s coach Lindsay Anfield has challenged her players to finally deliver on the big stage as she prepares to cross swords with Leeds Rhinos counterpart Adam Cuthbertson, who will temporarily replace her in the England set-up this autumn.

Anfield’s team face their West Yorkshire rivals in the Betfred Women’s Super League Grand Final on Friday night as they bid to avenge successive Challenge Cup final defeats at the hands of Cuthbertson’s side.

Castleford finished top of the eight-team competition to claim the League Leaders' Shield but could now win their first major trophy in front of the live Sky television cameras at St Helens' Totally Wicked Stadium.

The match is set to attract a crowd of over 2,000, setting a new record for a stand-alone women's rugby league fixture in the UK, and will also be screened by Fox Sports in Australia and beIN Sports in France.

Anfield said: “Last year we played Leeds in the Challenge Cup final and Super League play-off semi-final and got beat twice.
description: Castleford Tigers women’s coach Lindsay Anfield has challenged her players to finally deliver on the big stage as she prepares to cross swords with Leeds Rhinos counterpart Adam Cuthbertson, who will temporarily replace her in the England set-up this autumn.
